title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora urges Red Sox not to focus on playoffs, despite holding second wild card spot in AL.
Red Sox are 1.5 games behind Yankees for top wild-card spot and 4.5 games behind Blue Jays in AL East.
Boston faces tougher schedule compared to the Rangers, but still holds a 90%+ chance of making the playoffs.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow is prioritizing hiring a new general manager this offseason.
The team's general manager position has been vacant since Breslow took over Red Sox baseball operations in 2024.
Assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, Michael Groopman, Taylor Smith, and Paul Toboni are potential candidates.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints, receiving a 2027 sixth-round pick and giving up a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, drafted 37th overall in 2024, struggled with performance and comments, and ended up on injured reserve in 2025.
With this trade, only two players from the Patriots' 2024 draft class remain on the team.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots face a challenging away game against the Dolphins in Miami, having lost their last five matchups there.
Dolphins' quarterback Tua Tagovailoa remains undefeated against the Patriots with seven career wins and a 69% completion rate.
Dolphins' secondary struggles emerged, but their pass rush led by Bradley Chubb and Jaelan Phillips poses a threat.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner in Boston, delivering a Southern Gothic-inspired concert on September 12, 2025.
Cain's performance featured songs from her debut album and prequel, blending emotional storytelling with atmospheric stage design.
The concert included special appearances and an immersive encore, closely engaging the audience and transforming the concert space.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior', depicting a real-life story of redemption in college football.
Chiklis, a Lowell native, returns to Boston for a pre-release screening of 'The Senior' at AMC Boston Common on September 14.
The movie, directed by Rod Lurie, will have a national theatrical release on September 19, also featuring Rob Corddry and Mary Stuart Masterson.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Forbes' list of 400 richest Americans includes nine Massachusetts residents, with Abigail Johnson being the state's richest at $35 billion.
Abigail Johnson leads Massachusetts' rankings, moving from 30th to 27th with increased holdings in Fidelity Investments.
Amos Hostetter Jr. ranks 382nd, making him the least wealthy of the Massachusetts residents on the Forbes list.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost 4-1 to Yankees in series opener at Fenway Park on Friday night.
Boston's offense struggled, managing only two hits and going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.
Red Sox committed three errors, including a costly catcher's interference by Carlos Narvaez.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr., Washington Commanders DE, suffers season-ending left quad injury against Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, was injured blocking an extra point and will require surgery; his teammates showed support on the field.
Wise, former Patriots player, had signed a one-year $3.25 million deal with Commanders in March 2025.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early could start for the Red Sox against the A's at Fenway Park next Tuesday.
Early impressed in his MLB debut, striking out 11 A's batters over five scoreless innings.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora is evaluating options for starting positions among young pitchers like Early, Payton Tolle, and Kyle Harrison.
